Posts.Content: Hi Ladies I am just over a week into my 7th Chemo out of 8, so feeling better (Always feel awful the first week) and counting down to the last one. I had an MRI after my 4th one and my 4 hungry tumours had shrunk by half so couldn't ask for better results so I'm hoping my final MRI will show they've gone. After this will be surgery, my question is, how long do they normally leave you between Chemo and Surgery? if its weeks, will they allow me to fly to Italy for a few days? I'm thinking sod it, have a break.... xx
Posts.Title: Nearly done with Chemo

Posts.Content: Thanks Maggie, I'll check with the Oncologist, just starting to get impatient I think. All the best.
Posts.Title: Nearly done with Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi J So sorry to hear your news, I have a fur baby myself ( although a cat) who is quite frail now but has been by my side Not only just through cancer, but failed IVF and my mother dying, he got me through it all. I thank heaven I had him and I hope you will come to think the same of your baby, by your side when you needed them, a true companion who you loved and gave a wonderful life to. As you know better than most, it will take time to come to terms with. All the best S X
Posts.Title: What is it with cancer?

Posts.Content: Hi Mand I'm actually the other way round, my Cancer is Triple Negative and aggressive so had Chemo first, I have my last cycle of 8 next week. I won't lie, there are a few days when I don't feel well, but apart from that its the fatigue more than anything else.......everybody reacts differently, but I've yet to see a post where anyone didn't get themselves through it, you will be the same, you can do this! Just rest when you need to. For me now, the unknown is the mastectomy which I'm pretty scared about, but trying not to think about it till we get there. Keep your chin up. x
Posts.Title: Feeling overwhelmed!

Posts.Content: I would ideally like immediate reconstruction, but I'm yet to see a surgeon, the oncologist just wanted me to concentrate on the chemo for now. A breast lift! I'll take one of those too please :-) I consider myself to be quite a laid back person, but the Chemo did frighten me, but once you get into the swing of it and know how your body is going to react you do get used to when you are going to feel good or bad.....and lets face it, nothing in life is as bad as you can imagine it to be.....just your last sentence tells me you'll do it no problem. x
Posts.Title: Feeling overwhelmed!

Posts.Content: Hi Iona Great too hear your going out and enjoying yourself! Yes I get indigestion quite badly, very acidy, never had it before chemo! I was given Ranitidine by the hospital and it disappears really quickly so I would give them a call and ask for something better than over the counter. Good luck and have a fabulous Christmas. Sx
Posts.Title: sickness and indigestion

Posts.Content: Hi All, so, I'm on day 5 of my first chemo and thought I was doing relatively well until last night....apologies that it's toilet talk but my bowel movements I thought had been as normal until last night when I had what felt like diarrhoea pains, hot flush and nearly passed out! Same again today but not as dramatic and still a normal movement....not sure whether to take a laxative just to pass it through a bit quicker? Any advice or anyone had something similar would be a great help?? xx
Posts.Title: Strange SE

Posts.Content: Thanks JJ, it actually turned into diarrhoea so just trying to calm it down now. so glad I joined this site and yes I'll definitely join the club. all the best S
